noInternet.there: There seems to be a problem with your
noInternet.some: Some of the features will not work as expected in your Hexa app, including:

loaderMessages.heading: Savings Account
loaderMessages.text: The Savings Account unlocks once your backup is at Level 2. Also, setup your 2FA code on an authenticator app

loaderMessages.heading: Self-custody buys
loaderMessages.text: Get sats directly in your wallet from compatible exchanges

loaderMessages.heading: Friends & Family
loaderMessages.text: Add contacts to Hexa and send sats w/o asking for their wallet address every time

loaderMessages.text: Start receiving donations directly in your Hexa Wallet, from anywhere in the world

loaderMessages.heading: Satoshis or Sats
loaderMessages.subText: Hexa uses sats to make using bitcoin easier

login.appcreates: The app creates a new wallet for you with accounts you can start using right away
login.previously: If you previously had Hexa 2.0, you can recover it using the Recovery Keys with this option
login.restoreNoteV1: If you are trying to migrate from Hexa 1.0 to Hexa 2.0, please read how in the link below
login.proceeding: By proceeding to the next step, you agree to our
login.numbers: Numbers or special characters are not supported
login.WalletCreationNumbers: Wallet Name must contain only alphabets
login.Youcanincrease: You can increase your security level from the Security Center. Level 2 + Savings Account provides you with greater security while Level 3 adds further resiliency
login.Selectanencryption: Select an encryption option that is right for you. It is recommended that you have a backup in place before you start using the wallet
login.info: Wallet name is used in the messages you send to your Friends & Family contacts
login.Thismay: This may take a short time, while the app sets it all up for you:
login.Hexaencrypts: Hexa encrypts and secures all the data on the app and any communication that goes out
login.creatingbackup: Automatically creating backup on the cloud
login.preloading: Preloading the Test Account with test sats
login.Answersmust: Answers must only contain lowercase characters (a-z) and digits (0-9)
login.Passwordmust: Password must only contain lowercase characters (a-z) and digits (0-9)
login.Numbersorspecial: Numbers or special characters are not supported
login.Makesure: Make sure you remember the encryption password and keep it safe
login.Answersmust1: Answers must contain only lower case alphabets and numbers
login.securityQuestion: The Security Question acts as a
login.Youcanuse: You can use a mix of lowercase, capital letters & numbers. Because this maybe difficult to remember, its best to note it down
login.Createapassword: Provide a passphrase, use a 'Hint' to remember
login.Backuplets: Backup lets you recover your wallet even if you lose your phone. Manage from

login.Specifythe: Specify the answer as you did at the time of setting up the wallet
login.AGSP1: This is the most secure option for encrypting your backup. It is also the least memorable. Strong Password is used to encrypt the backup & can also be used when you forget your login passcode
login.AGSP2: If someone gets access to your cloud, this option makes your Level 1 backup even resistant to brute force attack
login.SecurityQuestion1: This is the most memorable option for encrypting your backup. It is also the least secure
login.SecurityQuestion2: If someone does get access to your cloud, this option makes your Level 1 backup resistant to manual guessing, not to computer brute force attack
login.UserDefinedPassphrase1: The security and the memorability of this option depends on the input provided by the user
login.UserDefinedPassphrase2: If someone does get access to your cloud, this option makes your Level 1 backup resistant to manual guessing and computer brute force attack depending on the strength of the passphrase used
login.Hexawillgenerate: Hexa will generate a strong password for you
login.HexaWalletcreated: Here's your App Generated Strong Passcode
login.Makesureyou: Make sure you have noted down the Strong Password and secured it
login.Itmayalso: If you lose this, you will not be able to access the wallet backup or reset the Login Passcode. It may be a good idea to secure more than one copy of the Strong Password
login.fromSecurityCenter: You can also set this up later from Security Center

home.rampSub: Low fee for those big buys
home.manyWays: Many ways to stack sats directly in Hexa
home.Allrecentnotifications: All your recent notifications will be visible here
home.rampMessage:
Ramp enables BTC purchases using Apple Pay, Debit/Credit card, Bank Transfer and open banking where available. Payment methods available may vary based on your country.

By proceeding, you understand that Ramp will process the payment and transfer for the purchased bitcoin.
home.rampProcessed: Your order is being processed by Ramp, once successful the purchased bitcoin will be transferred to your Ramp account
home.rampPaymentFail: Ramp was not able to process your payment. Please try after sometime or use a different payment method
home.wyreMessage:
Wyre enables BTC purchases using Apple Pay, debit card, bank transfer as well as easy transfers using open banking where available. Payment methods available may vary based on your country. 

By proceeding, you understand that Wyre will process the payment and transfer for the purchased bitcoin.
home.wyreProcessed: Your order is successful, the purchased bitcoin will be transferred to your Wyre account shortly
home.wyrePaymentFail: Wyre was not able to process your payment. Please try after sometime or use a different payment method

settings.AppInfoSub: Hexa app version number and details
settings.Disconnectyour: Disconnect your own node and connect to Hexa node
settings.Disconnectfrom: Disconnect from Hexa node and connect to your own
settings.nodeisaccessible: Make sure that your node is accessible at all times for the app to be able to connect to it
settings.HelpUstranslateSub: Did we lose something in translation? You can help us improve your language by proofreading and suggesting better translations.
settings.WalletID: Your Wallet ID is unique to your Hexa App
settings.currentversion: View apps current version and its history
settings.acrossyour: The wallet's name will get updated automatically across your Friends & Family network

header.Backupyour: Backup your wallet to safeguard your sats

stackTitle.ShowAllAccountsSub: Include Hidden and Archived accounts in your display

f&f.addressbook: You can choose from your phone's address book
f&f.giftSubText: Create bitcoin gifts that you can send to anyone. Get them back if not claimed
f&f.giftSubTextF&F: Give sats as gifts to your friends and family.
f&f.appear:
Your contacts appear here when
added to Hexa wallet
f&f.Select: Select a contact from your phone's address book
f&f.why:
Why do we need access
to your address book?
f&f.info:
If you want to associate an address book contact with your Friends & Family in Hexa, you will need to give access to your address book 


It is a good way to remember who the contacts are with their name and image
f&f.otherText: We neither store this data nor pass it to anyone else. This is for your convenience only
f&f.optionally: You can optionally add a second factor when you are sending the link/ QR through an unencrypted channel
f&f.number: Your contact will have to verify their phone number {0} to accept the request
f&f.email: Your contact will have to verify their email {0} to accept the request
f&f.otp: Your contact will have to confirm the OTP {0} to accept the request
f&f.select1: Select one of the below to add as a second factor to your link/QR
f&f.subText: An alphanumeric code will be generated
f&f.infoText: If the communication channel is not encrypted / secure, the second factor sent through a different channel improves the security guarantees
f&f.detailsOf: The details of your contact will appear here.
f&f.sure: Are you sure about removing the contact?
f&f.Removefrom: Remove the contact from Friends & Family
f&f.hexaWould: Hexa Would Like to Access Your Contacts
f&f.Hexaneedsaddressbook: Hexa needs access to your address book.
f&f.Addressbookdetails: Address book details are only stored locally
f&f.sendRecoveryKeyTo: Send Recovery Key to an existing contact or choose a new Contact from the address book.
f&f.Weneither: We neither store this data nor pass it to anyone else. This is for your convenience only
f&f.Nocontacts: No contacts found. Please add contacts to your Address Book and try again
f&f.Ifyouwantto:
If you want to associate an address book contact with your Friends & Family in Hexa, you will need to give access to your address book 

It is a good way to remember who the contacts are with their name and image
f&f.cannotSelect:
To see a list of address book contacts, you need to enable contact permission.
Go to Settings> Hexa > Contacts to allow

accounts.Chooseaccounttosendfrom: Choose the account to send from
accounts.tsatsSent: t-sats successfully sent from your account
accounts.satsSent: sats successfully sent from your account
accounts.test1: We realise that the world of Bitcoin could seem daunting at first. We’ve designed the Test Account to help demystify Bitcoin without risking your own funds
accounts.test2: Learn to use Hexa and bitcoin with the Test Account. Think of this account as the wallet’s training wheels!
accounts.test3: This account is loaded with test sats that you can send to your friend's Test Accounts. This helps you learn to transact using real sats, without sending real money
accounts.test4: Remember that test sats can only be sent to other wallets that also support test sats - don't try to send them to real bitcoin addresses
accounts.test5: With the Test Account, you can rest assured that, whatever you do, you aren't risking losing your real-world sats or bitcoin. The test sats have no monetary value, so they're risk-free
accounts.test6: Let your imagination run wild, try sending test sats to, and receiving sats, from multiple friends in different permutations and combinations!
accounts.checking1: Store some sats here, but not all. The sats here are your everyday sats - great for spending online or sending to your friends & family
accounts.checking2: For safely storing larger amounts of sats, you can use your Savings Account. This will keep your bitcoin safe and sound with better security!
accounts.checking3: Your Checking Account is a single signature account. Your Savings Account is a 2 of 3 multi-signature account, secured by an authenticator
accounts.checking4: Transactions from your Checking Account have lower fees compared to the Savings Account - keep bitcoin here for short-term holding or spending
accounts.checking5: Be careful! Someone having your phone's and Hexa wallet’s passcodes, could easily spend or send sats out of your Checking Account. Don't keep sats here you don't expect to use soon
accounts.checking6: Reminder: Due to the method we use to secure your Savings account, it is cheaper to send sats from your Checking Account compared to your Savings account
accounts.donation1: Collect donations for the causes of your choice - from all over the world.
accounts.donation2: Self-manage your Donation Account without worrying about the tech involved.
accounts.donation3: A web page and embed code for the account generates a new address every few minutes, helping with privacy of your transactions without needing any input from you.
accounts.donation4: Your supporters can donate by paying to the addresses these pages generate.
accounts.saving1: When you complete Level 2, you also have a personal device that you have used to store recovery key. The same device is used to create the second mnemonic needed for the Savings Account.
accounts.saving2: This means that your Savings Account is secure even if your phone is completely compromised
accounts.saving3: Use this account to store, or hold bitcoin and sats long term
accounts.saving4: Be careful: If you end up sending sats from your Checking Account to your Savings Account and then decide to spend sats from your Savings Account, it will cost you much more in transaction fees every time
accounts.saving5: The account needs you to set up a 2 Factor Authentication (2FA) system with your favorite authenticator software. This method makes it extremely hard for anyone but you to access your bitcoin
accounts.saving6: Your 2FA code must be retrieved from your Personal Device - do not ever set up 2 Factor Authentication for your Savings account on your wallet device, as this is a security risk
accounts.saving7: Your Savings Account is a 2-of-3 multi-signature account where you hold two keys (one on this device and the other on your Personal Device)
accounts.saving8: BitHyve holds the third key which is used only when you sign first and present the correct 2FA code. BitHyve never custodies any of your funds. The key held on the Personal Device can be used to migrate your funds from Hexa, even if we stop supporting the app!
accounts.Level2: You can use the Savings Account once you have upgraded your backup to Level 2
accounts.ShowxPubSub: Show details for this account's xPub
accounts.ArchiveSub: Move this account out of sight and out of mind
accounts.Youcanset: You can set the Name and Description to reflect the account's purpose.
accounts.Toreceive: To receive sats or bitcoin, you share the QR code with the person trying to send you money. Scanning the QR code with their phone camera gives them your bitcoin address.
accounts.Foryourprivacy: For your privacy, a new address is generated each time you want to receive sats or bitcoin. The app does this on its own - you don't have to do a thing!
accounts.Dependingon: Depending on the sender's wallet, you may receive a few less sats than you requested - this may be due to the mining fee.
accounts.Ifyoursender: If your sender sends the transaction with higher mining fees, it gets to you faster. Make sure they know!
accounts.Whenyousendsats: When you send sats, our app calculates the fees to get your money to your recipient within a certain window of time - or you can use a custom fee, if you know what you're doing.
accounts.Feesprovide: Fees provide additional incentives for the miner to process your transaction, resulting in you (or your recipient) receiving your sats faster.
accounts.Receivesatsinto: Receive sats into the selected account
accounts.Itwouldtake: It would take some time for the sats to reflect in your account based on the network congestion
accounts.scan: Scan a bitcoin address, a Hexa Friends & Family request, a Hexa Keeper request, or a recovery request
accounts.ScanaBitcoinaddress: Scan a Bitcoin address or any Hexa QR
accounts.YouhavenotaddedanyContacts: You have not added any Contacts
accounts.AddaContact: Add a Contact to send them sats without having to scan an address
accounts.AHidden: A Hidden Account is different from an Archived Account. Hidden Accounts can still have sats while an account needs to be emptied before being archived
accounts.Choosewhen: Choose when and if you want this account to appear on your Home Screen
accounts.Onlyshow: Only show when manually revealing all accounts
accounts.Duressmode: Only show in Duress mode -- or when manually revealing all accounts
accounts.Accountshouldbeempty: An account should be empty before it can be archived
accounts.archiveunusedaccount: You can archive an unused account from the home screen
accounts.accountisempty: Please ensure that account is empty before archiving
accounts.Startshowing: Start showing the account in My Accounts
accounts.RestoretoHomescreen: Restore the account to Home screen
accounts.Youcanhide: You can hide the account again from My Accounts from account settings
accounts.Onceconfirmed: Once confirmed you can use this account like a normal account from My Accounts
accounts.Yourkeys: Your keys, your coins, manage them your way
accounts.shareanaccount: Bitcoin is for everyone, share an account
accounts.somewhereelse: Have your sats somewhere else? Import them to Hexa
accounts.swanMessage:
Register with Swan Bitcoin and start stacking sats regularly. You also get $10 cash back when you complete the process. BTC can be purchased on Swan Bitcoin using different payment methods as available in your country


By proceeding you understand that you will be taken to Swan Bitcoin to complete registration
accounts.problemcommunicatingwithSwan: We had a problem communicating with Swan.
accounts.communicatingwithSwan: Your Hexa Wallet is communicating with Swan Bitcoin...
accounts.accountisbeinglinked:
This account is being linked with your profile on Swan Bitcoin.

This may take a few seconds, please do not close the application.
accounts.HexaWalletLinked: Your Hexa Wallet is now successfully linked to your Swan Bitcoin account. Sats will be transferred to Hexa as soon as you accumulate 1 million sats or 0.01 btc
accounts.Swanwilltransfer: Swan will transfer once 0.02 BTC accumulate in your Swan withdrawal wallet
accounts.swanlinked: Hexa Wallet and your Swan Account are linked
accounts.swanautowithdrawal:
This is your Swan Bitcoin auto-withdrawal wallet. When you stack with Swan Bitcoin, your sats will automatically get transferred to this self-custody account in Hexa once it reaches 0.01 btc. 

Claim a signup credit of $10 when you complete the process.
accounts.Byproceeding:
By proceeding you understand that you will be taken to Swan Bitcoin to complete the process.

Please check the available payment methods along with Terms and Conditions for using Swan Bitcoin as per your jurisdiction.
accounts.Onceyoucomplete: Once you complete the registration process or login in to your Swan Bitcoin account, you can use this wallet

bhr.Thehistory: The history of your Password will appear here
bhr.Thisisthefirstlevel: This is the first level of security of your wallet and we encourage you to proceed with this step while setting up the wallet
bhr.historyofyourbackup: The history of your backup will appear here
bhr.cloudBackupSuccessInfo: You have successfully backed up your wallet on the cloud.
bhr.cloudBackupNotSetupInfo: You can backup on the cloud and use the Recovery Key from the cloud when restoring.
bhr.cloudBackupInAccessibleInfo: You need to confirm your cloud connection, to ensure changes to your backup scheme.
bhr.historyofyourRecovery: The history of your Recovery Key will appear here
bhr.confirmingyourRecovery: For confirming your Recovery Key on the Personal Device, simply open the app on that device and log in
bhr.errorwhilesendingyourRecovery: There was an error while sending your Recovery Key, please try again in a little while
bhr.changetheKeeper: You can change the Keeper you selected to send your Recovery Key
bhr.approvethisrequest: Please approve this request by scanning the Approval Key stored with any of the other backups
bhr.ifyouwanttoreshare: Proceed if you want to reshare the link/ QR with the same device
bhr.differentdevice: For a different device, please go back and choose ‘Change device'
bhr.withanewcontact: Share your Recovery Key with a new contact or a different device
bhr.OpentheQRscanner: Open the QR scanner at the top right of the home screen on another Personal Device running Hexa app and scan this QR
bhr.Specifythepassword: Specify the password as you did at the time of setting up the wallet
bhr.BackupwithcloudSub: Backup the Recovery Key on cloud
bhr.BackupwithcontactSub: Backup the Recovery Key with a friend or family member
bhr.BackuponadeviceSub: Use another device running Hexa to secure the Recovery Key
bhr.BackupusingPDFSub: The Recovery Key gets stored in a PDF. Keep it safe digitally or physically as a print out
bhr.Thismaytake: This may take a short time, while the app sets it all up for you:
bhr.Hexaencrypts: Hexa encrypts and secures all the data on the app and any communication that goes out
bhr.Automaticallycreatingbackup: Automatically creating backup on the cloud
bhr.Preloading: Preloading the Test Account with test sats
bhr.errorwhilereceiving: There was an error while receiving your Recovery Key, please try again
bhr.Clickingon: Clicking on Recover would source your Recovery Key from iCloud
bhr.statusofyourRecovery: The status of your Recovery Key request is visible below
bhr.UseSendRequest: Use Send Request to share a link with a contact. If the person you wish to backup your Recovery Key with, is with you in person, use Scan Key. Or they could also send you a screenshot of the QR for you to scan
bhr.Selectcontactto: Select contact to send a Wallet Recovery request link
